probability

Class KLDivergence

  • java.lang.Object
    • probability.KLDivergence

  • public class KLDivergence
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the Kullback-Leibler divergence. Implicitly does absolute discounting smoothing prior when calculating the measure. This makes it defined for distributions which have zero probabilities without it going to infinity.

    • Method Detail

      • dist

        public float dist(float[] p,
         float[] q,
         int beginIndex,
         int endIndex)
        Calculates KL divergence between two probability distributions. Sometimes the distribution will be contained in a subarray in data instances. Hence , the begin and end index values.
        Parameters:
        p - First probability distribution, given as a float array.
        q - Second probability distribution, given as a float array.
        beginIndex - Start index of the distribution in the array.
        endIndex - End index of the distribution in the array.
        Returns:
        KL divergence between the distributions.

      • dist

        public float dist(float[] p,
         float[] q)
        Calculates KL divergence between two probability distributions.
        Parameters:
        p - First probability distribution, given as a float array.
        q - Second probability distribution, given as a float array.
        Returns:
        KL divergence between the distributions.
